title: How to read someone else's retweet on Twitter - Quora

response.answer_text:
You’ll have to do it scrolling the feed I was trying to use Twitter’s advanced search to create a way of viewing retweets only but couldn’t seem to get one working. You can, however, scroll down someone’s feed (providing they are a public account) and view all the retweets there. There doesn’t appear to be a way of filtering by them though. However, if you’ve got the tweet you want to view the retweets for search is more useful Say I wanted to read the retweets of this particular tweet 
 Copy the link for the tweet - you can do this using the sharing icons at the bottomThen paste that URL straight into the search box This will let you read the tweets of everyone who has retweeted it. But for filtering specific accounts for retweets only, that’s not possible without advanced function on Twitter. Let me know in the comments if you’ve got a tool/query to find that and I’ll be happy to feature it in this answer.
